fields.name: name
fields.description: Absolute file URI for triggered event

fields.name: operation
fields.description: Triggered event action. This can be create, delete or modify

records.name: FileEvent
records.description: Represents an event, which will trigger when there is a change to the listening directory.

fields.name: path
fields.description: Directory path which need to listen

fields.name: recursive
fields.description: Recursively monitor all sub folders or not in the given direcotry path

records.name: ListenerConfig
records.description: Represents the configurations that are required for a directory listener.

fields.name: modifiedTime
fields.description: The last modified time of the file

fields.name: dir
fields.description: Whether the file is a directory or not

fields.name: readable
fields.description: Whether the file is readable or not

fields.name: writable
fields.description: Whether the file is writable or not

records.name: MetaData
records.description:
Metadata record contains metadata information of a file.
This record is returned by getMetaData function.

parameters.description: Type descriptor of the service

otherMethods.name: detach

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents the directory listener endpoint, which is used to listen to a directory in the local file system.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of file path

returnParameters.description: The name of the file or else a `file:Error` if the path is invalid

functions.name: basename
functions.description:
Retrieves the base name of the file from the provided location,
which is the last element of the path.
Trailing path separators are removed before extracting the last element.
```ballerina
 string name = check file:basename("/A/B/C.txt");
```

parameters.name: sourcePath
parameters.description: String value of the old file path

parameters.name: destinationPath
parameters.description: String value of the new file path

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Parameter to denote how the copy operation should be done. Supported options are,
`REPLACE_EXISTING` - Replace the target path if it already exists,
`COPY_ATTRIBUTES` - Copy the file attributes as well to the target,
`NO_FOLLOW_LINKS` - If source is a symlink, only the link is copied, not the target of the link.

returnParameters.description: An `file:Error` if failed to copy

functions.name: copy
functions.description:
Copy the file/directory in the old path to the new path.
```ballerina
check file:copy("/A/B/C", "/A/B/D", true);
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path

returnParameters.description: A `file:Error` if file creation failed

functions.name: create
functions.description:
Creates a file in the specified file path.
Truncates if the file already exists in the given path.
```ballerina
check file:create("bar.txt");
```

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: Directory name

parameters.name: option
parameters.description:
Indicates whether the `createDir` should create non-existing parent directories. The default is only to
create the given current directory.

returnParameters.description: A `file:Error` if the directory creation failed

functions.name: createDir
functions.description:
Creates a new directory with the specified name.
```ballerina
check file:createDir("foo/bar");
```

parameters.name: suffix
parameters.description: Optional file suffix

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Optional file prefix

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description:
The directory path where the temp file should be created. If not specified,
temp file will be created in the default temp directory of the OS.

returnParameters.description: Temporary file path or else a `file:Error` if there is an error

functions.name: createTemp
functions.description:
Creates a temporary file.
```ballerina
string tmpFile = check file:createTemp();
```

parameters.name: suffix
parameters.description: Optional directory suffix

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Optional directory prefix

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description:
The directory path where the temp directory should be created. If not specified, temp directory
will be created in the default temp directory of the OS.

returnParameters.description: Temporary directory path or else a `file:Error` if there is an error

functions.name: createTempDir
functions.description:
Creates a temporary directory.
```ballerina
string tmpDir = check file:createTempDir();
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path free from potential malicious codes

returnParameters.description: The absolute path reference or else a `file:Error` if the path cannot be derived

functions.name: getAbsolutePath
functions.description:
Retrieves the absolute path from the provided location.
```ballerina
 string absolutePath = check file:getAbsolutePath("test.txt");
```

returnParameters.description: Current working directory or else an empty string if the current working directory cannot be determined

functions.name: getCurrentDir
functions.description:
Returns the current working directory.
```ballerina
string dirPath = file:getCurrentDir();
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path.

returnParameters.description: The `MetaData` instance with the file metadata or else a `file:Error`

functions.name: getMetaData
functions.description:
Returns the metadata information of the file specified in the file path.
```ballerina
file:MetaData result = check file:getMetaData("foo/bar.txt");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path

returnParameters.description:
`true` if path is absolute, `false` otherwise, or else an `file:Error`
occurred if the path is invalid

functions.name: isAbsolutePath
functions.description:
Reports whether the path is absolute.
A path is absolute if it is independent of the current directory.
On Unix, a path is absolute if it starts with the root.
On Windows, a path is absolute if it has a prefix and starts with the root: c:\windows.
```ballerina
 boolean isAbsolute = check file:isAbsolutePath("/A/B/C");
```

parameters.name: parts
parameters.description: String values of the file path parts

returnParameters.description: String value of the file path or else a `file:Error` if the parts are invalid

functions.name: joinPath
functions.description:
Joins any number of path elements into a single path.
```ballerina
 string path = check file:joinPath("/", "foo", "bar");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path

parameters.name: option
parameters.description:
Normalization option. Supported options are,
`CLEAN` - Get the shortest path name equivalent to the given path by eliminating multiple separators, '.', and '..',
`SYMLINK` - Evaluate a symlink,
`NORMCASE` - Normalize the case of a pathname. On windows, all the characters are converted to lowercase and "/" is
converted to "\\".

returnParameters.description: Normalized file path or else a `file:Error` if the path is invalid

functions.name: normalizePath
functions.description:
Normalizes a path value.
```ballerina
 string normalizedPath = check file:normalizePath("foo/../bar", file:CLEAN);
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file/directory path

returnParameters.description:
Path of the parent directory or else a `file:Error`
if an error occurred while getting the parent directory

functions.name: parentPath
functions.description:
Returns the enclosing parent directory.
If the path is empty, parent returns ".".
The returned path does not end in a separator unless it is the root directory.
```ballerina
 string parentPath = check file:parentPath("/A/B/C.txt");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the directory path

returnParameters.description: The `MetaData` array or else a `file:Error` if there is an error

functions.name: readDir
functions.description:
Reads the directory and returns a list of metadata of files and directories
inside the specified directory.
```ballerina
file:MetaData[] results = check file:readDir("foo/bar");
```

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: String value of the base file path

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: String value of the target file path

returnParameters.description:
The target path relative to the base path, or else an
`file:Error` if target path cannot be made relative to the base path

functions.name: relativePath
functions.description:
Returns a relative path, which is logically equivalent to the target path when joined to the base path with an
intervening separator.
An error is returned if the target path cannot be made relative to the base path.
```ballerina
 string relative = check file:relativePath("a/b/e", "a/c/d");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file/directory path

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: Indicates whether the `remove` should recursively remove all the files inside the given directory

returnParameters.description: An `file:Error` if failed to remove

functions.name: remove
functions.description:
Removes the specified file or directory.
```ballerina
check file:remove("foo/bar.txt");
```

parameters.name: oldPath
parameters.description: String value of the old file path

parameters.name: newPath
parameters.description: String value of the new file path

returnParameters.description: An `file:Error` if failed to rename

functions.name: rename
functions.description:
Renames(Moves) the old path with the new path.
If the new path already exists and it is not a directory, this replaces the file.
```ballerina
check file:rename("/A/B/C", "/A/B/D");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path

returnParameters.description: String array of the path components or else a `file:Error` if the path is invalid

functions.name: splitPath
functions.description:
Splits a list of paths joined by the OS-specific path separator.
```ballerina
 string[] parts = check file:splitPath("/A/B/C");
```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path

parameters.name: testOption
parameters.description:
The option to be tested upon the path. Supported options are,
`EXISTS` - Test whether a file path exists,
`IS_DIR` - Test whether a file path is a directory,
`IS_SYMLINK` - Test whether a file path is a symlink,
`READABLE` - Test whether a file path is readable,
`WRITABLE` - Test whether a file path is writable.

returnParameters.description: True/false depending on the option to be tested or else a `file:Error` if there is an error

functions.name: test
functions.description:
Tests a file path against a test condition .
```ballerina
boolean result = check file:test("foo/bar.txt", file:EXISTS);
```

errors.name: Error
errors.description: Represents file system related errors.

errors.name: FileNotFoundError
errors.description: Represents an error, which occurs when the file/directory does not exist in the given file path.

errors.name: FileSystemError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation fails.

errors.name: GenericError
errors.description: Represents a generic error for the file path.

errors.name: InvalidOperationError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation is denied due to invalidity.

errors.name: InvalidPathError
errors.description: Represents an error, which occurs when the given file path is invalid.

errors.name: InvalidPatternError
errors.description: Represents an error, which occurs when the given pattern is not a valid file path pattern.

errors.name: IOError
errors.description: Represents an IO error, which occurs when trying to access the file in the given file path.

errors.name: NotLinkError
errors.description: Represents an error, which occurs when the file in the given file path is not a symbolic link.

errors.name: PermissionError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation is denied, due to the absence of file permission.

errors.name: RelativePathError
errors.description: Represents an error, which occurs when the given target file path cannot be derived relative to the base file path.

errors.name: SecurityError
errors.description: Represents a security error, which occurs when trying to access the file in the given file path.

errors.name: UNCPathError
errors.description: Represents an error, which occurs in the UNC path.

members.name: REPLACE_EXISTING
members.description: Replace the target path if it already exists

members.name: COPY_ATTRIBUTES
members.description: Copy the file attributes as well to the target

members.name: NO_FOLLOW_LINKS
members.description: If source is a symlink, only the link is copied, not the target of the link

enums.name: CopyOption
enums.description: Represents options that can be used when copying files/directories

members.name: RECURSIVE
members.description: Create non-existing parent directories or remove all the files inside the given directory

enums.name: DirOption
enums.description: Represents options that can be used when creating or removing directories.

members.name: CLEAN
members.description: Get the shortest path name equivalent to the given path by eliminating multiple separators, '.', and '..'

members.name: NORMCASE
members.description:
Normalize the case of a pathname. On windows, all the characters are converted to lowercase and "/" is
converted to "\".

enums.name: NormOption
enums.description: Represents the options that can be passed to the `normalizePath` function.

members.name: EXISTS
members.description: Test whether a file path exists

members.name: IS_DIR
members.description: Test whether a file path is a directory

members.name: IS_SYMLINK
members.description: Test whether a file path is a symlink

members.name: READABLE
members.description: Test whether a file path is readable

members.name: WRITABLE
members.description: Test whether a file path is writable

enums.name: TestOption
enums.description: Represents the options that can be passed to the test function.

modules.summary: This module provides APIs to create, delete, rename the file/directory, retrieve metadata of the given file, and manipulate the file paths in a way that is compatible with the operating system, and a `Directory Listener`, which is used to listen to the file changes in a directory in the local file system.
modules.description:
## Overview

This module provides APIs to create, delete, rename the file/directory, retrieve metadata of the given file, and manipulate the file paths in a way that is compatible with the operating system, and a `Directory Listener`, which is used to listen to the file changes in a directory in the local file system.

This also provides the following separators which are widely used in file path creation:
-  `file:pathSeparator`: It is a character used to separate the parent directories that make up the path to a specific location. For windows, its \ and for UNIX its /
-  `file:pathListSeparator`: It is a character commonly used by the operating system to separate paths in the path list. For windows, its ; and for UNIX its :

### Directory listener

The `file:Listener` is used to monitor all the files and subdirectories inside the specified directory. 

A `Listener` endpoint can be defined using the mandatory `path` parameter and the optional `recursive` parameter as follows.

```ballerina
listener file:Listener inFolder = new ({
    path: "<The directory path>",
    recursive: false
});
```

If the listener needs to monitor subdirectories of the given directory, `recursive` needs to be set to `true`. The default value of this is `false`.

A `Service` has the defined remote methods with the `file:FileEvent` and can be exposed via a `Listener` endpoint. 
When there are changes in the listening directory, the `file:FileEvent` will be triggered with the action of the file 
such as creating, modifying, or deleting. 

The remote methods supported by the `Service` are as follows.

**onCreate:** This method is invoked once a new file is created in the listening directory.

**onDelete:** This method is invoked once an existing file is deleted from the listening directory.

**onModify:** This method is invoked once an existing file is modified in the listening directory.

The following code sample shows how to create a `Service` with the `onCreate` remote method and attach it to the above `Listener` endpoint:

```ballerina
service "localObserver" on inFolder {

    remote function onCreate(file:FileEvent m) {
        string msg = "Create: " + m.name;
        log:printInfo(msg);
    }
}
```

For information on the operations, which you can perform with the file module, see the below **Functions**.

This module provides APIs to create, delete, rename the file/directory, retrieve metadata of the given file, and manipulate the file paths in a way that is compatible with the operating system, and a `Directory Listener`, which is used to listen to the file changes in a directory in the local file system.

functions.description:
Retrieves the base name of the file from the provided location,
which is the last element of the path.
Trailing path separators are removed before extracting the last element.
```ballerina
 string name = check file:basename("/A/B/C.txt");
```

Copy the file/directory in the old path to the new path.
```ballerina
check file:copy("/A/B/C", "/A/B/D", true);
```

Creates a file in the specified file path.
Truncates if the file already exists in the given path.
```ballerina
check file:create("bar.txt");
```

Creates a new directory with the specified name.
```ballerina
check file:createDir("foo/bar");
```

Creates a temporary file.
```ballerina
string tmpFile = check file:createTemp();
```

Creates a temporary directory.
```ballerina
string tmpDir = check file:createTempDir();
```

Retrieves the absolute path from the provided location.
```ballerina
 string absolutePath = check file:getAbsolutePath("test.txt");
```

Returns the current working directory.
```ballerina
string dirPath = file:getCurrentDir();
```

Returns the metadata information of the file specified in the file path.
```ballerina
file:MetaData result = check file:getMetaData("foo/bar.txt");
```

Reports whether the path is absolute.
A path is absolute if it is independent of the current directory.
On Unix, a path is absolute if it starts with the root.
On Windows, a path is absolute if it has a prefix and starts with the root: c:\windows.
```ballerina
 boolean isAbsolute = check file:isAbsolutePath("/A/B/C");
```

Joins any number of path elements into a single path.
```ballerina
 string path = check file:joinPath("/", "foo", "bar");
```

Normalizes a path value.
```ballerina
 string normalizedPath = check file:normalizePath("foo/../bar", file:CLEAN);
```

Returns the enclosing parent directory.
If the path is empty, parent returns ".".
The returned path does not end in a separator unless it is the root directory.
```ballerina
 string parentPath = check file:parentPath("/A/B/C.txt");
```

Reads the directory and returns a list of metadata of files and directories
inside the specified directory.
```ballerina
file:MetaData[] results = check file:readDir("foo/bar");
```

Returns a relative path, which is logically equivalent to the target path when joined to the base path with an
intervening separator.
An error is returned if the target path cannot be made relative to the base path.
```ballerina
 string relative = check file:relativePath("a/b/e", "a/c/d");
```

Removes the specified file or directory.
```ballerina
check file:remove("foo/bar.txt");
```

Renames(Moves) the old path with the new path.
If the new path already exists and it is not a directory, this replaces the file.
```ballerina
check file:rename("/A/B/C", "/A/B/D");
```

Splits a list of paths joined by the OS-specific path separator.
```ballerina
 string[] parts = check file:splitPath("/A/B/C");
```

Tests a file path against a test condition .
```ballerina
boolean result = check file:test("foo/bar.txt", file:EXISTS);
```

records.description: Represents an event, which will trigger when there is a change to the listening directory.
Represents the configurations that are required for a directory listener.

Metadata record contains metadata information of a file.
This record is returned by getMetaData function.

errors.description: Represents file system related errors.
Represents an error, which occurs when the file/directory does not exist in the given file path.
Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation fails.
Represents a generic error for the file path.
Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation is denied due to invalidity.
Represents an error, which occurs when the given file path is invalid.
Represents an error, which occurs when the given pattern is not a valid file path pattern.
Represents an IO error, which occurs when trying to access the file in the given file path.
Represents an error, which occurs when the file in the given file path is not a symbolic link.
Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation is denied, due to the absence of file permission.
Represents an error, which occurs when the given target file path cannot be derived relative to the base file path.
Represents a security error, which occurs when trying to access the file in the given file path.
Represents an error, which occurs in the UNC path.

listeners.description: Represents the directory listener endpoint, which is used to listen to a directory in the local file system.

enums.description: Represents options that can be used when copying files/directories
Represents options that can be used when creating or removing directories.
Represents the options that can be passed to the `normalizePath` function.
Represents the options that can be passed to the test function.
